QueueName.title: QueueName
QueueName.description: The queue name. The name must be 1 to 15 characters in length and can contain letters, digits, and periods (.).

EnableScaleOut.title: EnableScaleOut
EnableScaleOut.description:
Specifies whether to enable auto scale-out for the queue. Valid values:

*   true: enables auto scale-out.
*   false: disables auto scale-out.

EnableScaleIn.title: EnableScaleIn
EnableScaleIn.description:
Specifies whether to enable auto scale-in for the queue. Valid values:

*   true: enables auto scale-in.
*   false: disables auto scale-in.

MinCount.title: MinCount
MinCount.description: The minimum number of compute nodes that the queue must contain.

MaxCount.title: MaxCount
MaxCount.description: The maximum number of compute nodes that the queue can contain.

InitialCount.title: InitialCount
InitialCount.description: The initial number of compute nodes in the queue.

InterConnect.title: HPCInterConnect
InterConnect.description:
The type of the network between compute nodes in the queue. Valid values:

*   vpc
*   eRDMA

VSwitchIds.title: VSwitchIds
VSwitchIds.description: The available vSwitches for compute nodes in the queue. Valid values of N: 1 to 5.

ComputeNodes.title: Resources
ComputeNodes.description: The hardware configurations of the compute nodes in the queue. Valid values of N: 0 to 10.

items.description: The hardware configuration of the compute node.

AllocationStrategy.title: AllocationStrategy
AllocationStrategy.description: The auto scaling policy for the queue.

RamRole.title: RamRole
RamRole.description: The role that is assumed by compute nodes in the queue.

HostnamePrefix.title: HostNamePrefix
HostnamePrefix.description: The hostname prefix of the compute nodes in the queue.

HostnameSuffix.title: HostNameSuffix
HostnameSuffix.description: The hostname suffix of the compute nodes in the queue.

KeepAliveNodes.title: KeepAliveNodes
KeepAliveNodes.description: The nodes for which deletion protection is enabled in the queue.

items.description: The hostname of the node for which deletion protection is enabled.

MaxCountPerCycle.title: MaxCountPerCycle
MaxCountPerCycle.description: The maximum number of compute nodes that can be added to the queue in each scale-out.

MountDirectory.description: The local mount directory of the mounted file system.

FileSystemId.description: The ID of the mounted file system.

NASDirectory.description: The remote mount directory of the mounted file system.

MountTargetDomain.description: The address of the mount point of the file system.

ProtocolType.description:
The protocol type of the mounted file system. Valid values:

*   NFS
*   SMB

MountOptions.description: The storage mount options of the mounted file system.

*   \-t nfs -o vers=4.0,noresvport

MountTarget.description: The mount target of the attached file system.

ProtocolType.description:
The protocol used by the mount target of the attached file system. Valid values:

*   nfs3
*   nfs4
*   cpfs

FileSystemProtocol.description:
The protocol used by the attached file system. Valid values:

*   nfs3
*   nfs4

schema.description:

Pages start from page 1.

Default value: 1.

The number of entries per page. Valid values: 1 to 50.

Default value: 10

PageSize.description: The number of entries per page.

AddTime.description: The time when the user was first added.

Group.description:
The name of the permission group. Valid values:

users: ordinary permissions, which are suitable for regular users that need only to submit and debug jobs.

wheel: sudo permissions, which are suitable for administrators who need to manage clusters. In addition to submitting and debugging jobs, you can also run sudo commands to install software and restart nodes.

GetJobLog.summary: Queries the output logs of a job, including standard output logs and error output logs.

schema.description:
The log type. Valid values:

*   stdout: standard output logs.
*   stderr: error output logs.
*   all: all logs.

Default value: all.

The maximum size of logs that you can read in a single request.

Unit: bytes.

Default value: 10240.

The position where logs start to be read.

Unit: bytes.

Default value: 0.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the request was successful. Valid values:

*   true: The request was successful.
*   false: The request failed.

StdoutLog.description: The standard output log that is encoded in Base64.

StderrLog.description: The error output log that is encoded in Base64.

StdoutLogSize.description: The size of the standard output file.

StderrLogSize.description: The size of the error output file.
